title: The Lacemaker = La Dentelliere
subject_group: Literature/French literature - Film and video adaptations
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Foreign language films
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Interpersonal conflict
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Social classes
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Interpersonal conflict
description: Pomme works as a hairdresser and lives with her protective mother in Paris. She goes on a holiday to the seaside town of Cabourg with a more worldly friend. There she forms a relationship with Francois, a young student, and they decide to live together in Paris. Social differences soon emerge. While Francois is garrulously intellectual, Pomme is reserved, incapable of communicating with Francois and his friends but maintaining a mysterious inner radiance. Goretta has described his film as "a genre painting" in narrative form and it is constructed in a series of brief fragmentary scenes which form a picture without evident narrative connections. With its narrative ellipses - eloquent silences and observation of Pomme's mysterious inner life - Goretta's film resembles Bresson's "Une Femme Douce". Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Yves Benneyton, Florence Giorgetti, and Anne-Marie Duringer. Based on the novel by Pascal Laine. In French with English subtitles.
